description.narrative:
Beyond 2015 is an international campaign dedicated to provide collective input on a national, regional and international level into the intergovernmental negotiation process regarding the establishment of a post-2015 development framework that will replace the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs). The Campaign started in the end of 2010 and will continue until March 2016, since it follows the UN-process of international negotiations regarding the post-2015 agenda.The vision of Beyond 2015 is to strengthen the links between organisations participating in the campaign and to provide support and resources for them to effectively participate in this campaign. One of the most important aspects of the work of Beyond 2015 is to enure that voices from Southern CSOs and those most affected by poverty and injustice, are taken to the global debates and to key OECD countries playing a key role in the post-2015 agenda.
The overall purpose is that political, economic and social resources must be directed towards the issues which matter most to people living in acute poverty and ensure not just absolute improvement in measurable indicators of poverty, but also improvements in the equality of relative progress within those indicators. The overall purpose reflects what development problem the intervention targets.
By lifting the voices of the South into the negotiation process of the post-2015 agenda better and more sustainable improvements can be made, according to Beyond 2015.
Beyond 2015 is requesting further funding from Sida of approximately 9 800 000 SEK (€ 1 081 000) for the period of January 1st 2014 until March 31st 2016. However, Beyond 2015 has already received funding till May 31st 2014 from Sida through a second amendment to the previous agreement between Sida and the former fiscal agent for the Beyond 2015 project – CONCORD. The requested amount should therefore be corrected to approximately 8 000 000 SEK and cover the period of September 1st till March 31st.
Over this period Beyond 2015 will reach its most political stage of the post-2015 process, meaning that various consultative processes has come to an end, giving room for a more closed process of intergovernmental negotiations. During this period there are three main bodies that will lead the process of further defining the post-2015 framework: The Open Working Group on Sustainable Development Goals, The High Level Political Forum and the Intergovernmental Committee of Experts on Sustainable Development Financing. It is from within these bodies and the more closed intergovernmental negotiations that Beyond 2015 will continue the advocacy and exercise the influence that has been achieved during the earlier period of the campaign.

Beyond 2015 är en internationell kampanj som syftar till att bedriva ett påverkansarbete av den mellanstatliga förhandlingsprocessen gällande inrättandet av ett ramverk som ska ersätta milleniemålen (MDG), den så kallade post 2015-agendan. Kampanjen startade i slutet av 2010 och kommer att pågå till mars 2016, då den följer FN-processen av internationella förhandlingar beträffande post 2015-agendan.
Kampanjens vision är att stärka banden mellan organisationer som deltar i kampanjen och att ge stöd och resurser till dessa organisationer. En av de viktigaste aspekterna i kampanjens arbete är att försäkra att civilsamhällesorganisationer (CSO) från Syd och de som påverkas mest av fattigdom och orättvisor, syns och hörs i de globala debatterna i OECD-länderna som spelar en nyckelroll i post 2015-agendan.
Det övergripande syftet med kampanjen är att politiska, ekonomiska och sociala resurser måste riktas mot de frågor som betyder mest för människor som lever i akut fattigdom och att inte bara garantera förbättring i mätbara fattigdomsindikatorer, utan också förbättringar i likvärdiga, relativa, framsteg inom dessa indikatorer. Genom att lyfta röster i Syd i förhandlingsprocessen av post 2015-agendan kan bättre och mer hållbara förbättringar göras, enligt Beyond 2015.
Beyond 2015 har finansierats av Sida sedan 2012 och begär ytterligare finansiering från Sida på cirka 10 000 000 SEK (€ 1 081 000) för perioden 1 januari 2014 till 31 mars 2016. Dock har Beyond 2015 har redan fått finansiering av Sida fram till den 31 augusti 2014, genom ett tilläggsavtal till det tidigare avtalet mellan Sida och CONCORD, som är Sidas tidigare avtalspart för Beyond 2015-projektet. Det begärda beloppet bör därför ändras till cirka 8 300 000 kronor, för perioden 1 september 2014 till 31 mars 2016.
Under denna period kommer projektet att nå sin mest politiska fas. Detta innebär att olika nationella samrådsprocesser har avslutats och att en mer sluten process genom mellanstatliga förhandlingar nu påbörjas. Under denna period finns det tre huvudorgan som kommer att leda arbetet med att ytterligare definiera post 2015-ramverket: Open Working Group on Sustainable Development Goals, Highlevel Political Forum och Intergovernmental Committee of Experts on Sustainable Development Financing. Det är inifrån dessa organ och de mellanstatliga förhandlingarna som Beyond 2015 kommer att fortsätta sin opinionsbildning och utöva det inflytande som har uppnåtts under den tidigare perioden av kampanjen.
Målen för kampanjen för perioden januari 2014 - mars 2016 är (översatt från ansökan): - Att säkerställa att post 2015-agendan påverkas av Beyond 2015 och deras partners politiska ståndpunkter. - Att skapa en mer enhetlig, informerad och samordnad global kampanj, samarbete på nationell, regional och internationell nivå för att påverka post 2015-agendan för utveckling. - Att se till att forskning om deltagande är tillgänglig för CSOerna och andra aktörer och att det tas in på ett meningsfullt sätt i hela den mellanstatliga förhandlingsprocessen. - Att stödja 15-20 stater, som stödjer minst två eller flera av Beyond 2015s värderingar, att ta progressiva positioner under den mellanstatliga processen.

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The project goal was met with satisfaction; the positions taken by Beyond 2015 were clearly reflected in the final version of the SDGs. Furthermore, the action managed to through participatory research capture issues affecting the poor as well as the injustices those faced.
As for the specific objectives, these will be commented on below: OBJECTIVE 1: "To create a more unified, informed and coordinated global campaign, working together at the national, regional and international level to influence the post-2015 development agenda." The Beyond 2015-campaign held several webinars, negotiating sessions and had national as well as regional hubs to coordinate its work. While progress within the regional hubs was uneven, partially due to capacity and partially due to geographical constraints, over all the unifying aspects of these hubs are assessed as successful in meeting the objective set out. OBJECTIVE 2: "To ensure that the post-2015 agenda is influenced by Beyond 2015 and their partners' policy positions" While it's hard to prove causation in questions like these, there is a clear correlation between many of Beyond 2015's positions and the wording in Agenda 2030. Members from the global South were supported to participate in the Open Working Group and intergovernmental negotiation processes in New York, and at least 6 national leads were part of their official government delegations to New York. The objective is therefore assessed as fulfilled. OBJECTIVE 3: "To ensure that high quality participatory research is available to CSOs and other actors, and that it is taken into account meaningfully throughout the intergovernmental negotiation process." The Beyond 2015 campaign mainly relied on the Participate initiative, which is a global research collaboration, to attain this objective. Its results were communicated through workshops with selected countries where the results of Participate research were formed into concrete recommendations for policy makers, webinars where the findings were presented and discussed with a wider spectrum Beyond 2015-members as well as at a working session held in Pretoria where members of the Participate Research Group assembled to give feedback on the policy papers. Several key meetings were held, with people working in areas more heavily affected by marginalisation such as poverty and injustice being in attendance to ensure the findings being properly communicated throughout the entirety of the Beyond 2015 campaign. OBJECTIVE 4: "To support 15-20 states who are sympathetic to and supportive of two or more of Beyond 2015's values to take progressive positions during the interngovernmental process." In the final report, the number of states supported was reduced to "7-10 states". The final number of states targeted was 7. The Supportive State initative strengthened ties between CSOs and governement, and became the modus operandi of Beyond 2015. It also led to specific governments adopting Beyond 2015 policies in their official positions during the IGNs. The advocacy work conducted by the Beyond 2015 campaign in these states is largely presented as successful despite the lesser actual number of states reached.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
